name: Medical Residency Scheduler - Phase 2: Smart Resident Association (Absence-Aware)
description: Phase 2: Intelligent resident association with Phase 0/1 integration - uses field IDs for all Airtable operations

meta.description: Phase 2: Revolutionary resident association using field IDs for all Airtable operations
meta.author: Medical Scheduling Optimization Team

phase2_specifications.purpose: Intelligently associate residents with master assignments using Phase 0 absence data and Phase 1 smart pairings

revolutionary_features.field_id_based_operations: All Airtable operations use field IDs instead of names for reliability
revolutionary_features.resident_absence_awareness: Checks resident availability BEFORE creating associations
revolutionary_features.verbatim_resident_substitution: Applies resident absence comments as replacement activities immediately
revolutionary_features.orphan_prevention: Only associates available residents or creates substitutions
revolutionary_features.phase5_elimination_continuation: Continues the elimination of post-hoc leave overrides
revolutionary_features.end_to_end_absence_integration: Completes the Faculty (Phase 1) + Resident (Phase 2) absence awareness

input_dependencies: Phase 0 absence data (CRITICAL - resident absence lookup)
Phase 1 master assignments (smart pairings with faculty already handled)

key_improvements_over_original.field_id_reliability: Uses field IDs throughout to prevent field rename issues
key_improvements_over_original.immediate_substitution: Applies resident absence substitutions during association, not later
key_improvements_over_original.intelligent_resident_selection: Prioritizes available residents, handles absent ones with substitutions
key_improvements_over_original.workflow_continuity: Maintains the intelligent approach from Phase 1
key_improvements_over_original.phase5_elimination: Further reduces Phase 5 workload with resident substitutions

outputs: Master Assignments with residents associated (updated records using field IDs)
success_criteria: ‚â•80% of master assignments successfully associated with residents
Phase 0 and Phase 1 data successfully integrated
Ready for Phase 3 faculty assignment processing
All Airtable operations use field IDs for reliability
